etymology.description: Simplified from 變 (biàn, "change"): 言(言) (yán, "speech") + 糸(糸) (mì, "silk"). The silk 糸 radical in the original has been omitted, and the 言(言) (yán) component has been merged with simplified 又(又) (yòu, "again") to create 变.
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 變 (biàn, "change") combines the speech 言(言) (yán, "speech") and silk 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") elements, symbolizing change through communication and intricacy. The simplified form 变 streamlines this by removing silk 糸 and simplifying the rest for ease of writing.
etymology.simplification: 变 is the result of simplifying the traditional character 變 by removing the silk 糸 component and using 又(又) (yòu, "again") for a streamlined form.

examples.chinese: 时间在悄悄地变(時間在悄悄地變)。
他的心态变得积极(他的心態變得積極)，看待问题更开放(看待問題更開放)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xīntaì biàn dé jījí, kàndài wèntí gèng kāifàng.
examples.english: His mindset became positive, and he viewed problems more openly.

examples.chinese: 书籍的封面在风雨中变得斑驳(書籍的封面在風雨中變得斑駁)，承载着岁月的痕迹(承載著歲月的痕跡)。
examples.pinyin: Shūjí de fēngmiàn zài fēngyǔ zhōng biàn dé bānbó, chéngzài zhe suìyuè de hénjì.
examples.english: The cover of the book became mottled in the wind and rain, bearing the marks of time.
